inn1.comm: good length ball as he goes fishing for the outside edge, Kusal won't bite
crisp drive from Kusal as he leans forward to a fuller ball with a slightly open face. Lovely timing, but doesn't hit the gap in the covers
flash and miss, that's his game. Any hint of width and he will lash out whatever happens
flies over the slips. It's another teaser outside off and Steyn gets the batsman to do what he wants, throw his bat at it, but the outside edge is thick enough to lob the second slip handsomely
terrific bowling! Pulls his length back here after he's got Perera's drive going. Watches a good length ball jag away from the pitch and beat the on-the-up shot
in the air, again the outside edge skews away safely to third man. Pretty tight start from Steyn as he targeted the off-stump corridor
nice and tight on middle, helped by a little nip in off the deck, Kusal manages to bring down a straight bat. Seeks a single into the covers, but Dilshan, rightly, says no
a bit short, a lot wide and Kusal can't help himself but flay at it. Nerves showing themselves. Beaten
full and wide, definite tactic as Kusal pokes and misses outside off again

edged and de Kock has pulled off an absolute stunner! One-hander diving to his left, and he's nearly taken it out of first slip's purview! It was a top ball to start, hitting that uncertain length where the batsman doesn't know where to put his front foot. Down comes the bat with hard hands, the away swing takes the outside edge and de Kock.... well, it popped out too but he reached further with that left hand, had his eyes on it even in the midst of a dive and took it! phew!
back of a length on middle, Sanga answers with a stoic, straight bat
good length ball with a little away shape, Dilshan steps forward and drives on the up to the left of mid-off
full and curling away, Dilshan was plying the line and goes for a flick. Gets a leading edge to mid-off. Mimics the shape with his hand after the fact
fuller delivery on and around off stump, Dilshan is forward with a firm push to short cover
a shade short, and wide enough for Dilshan's eyes to light up. The info hadn't been sent to his feet though as he stands rooted and slashes. Beaten
he's getting the ball to curve away quite nicely, and his direction is pin-point. Right on middle and Dilshan does well to use a straight bat and drive to mid-on
good length ball nipping away, Dilshan has it covered with a tap to short cover
too good! And if it's too good for Sanga, you log it down as unplayable. Pitched on a good length and jags away sharply. The batsman pushes with hard hands and is beaten
there certain is swing, even with the replacement ball. Only Abbott's directed the inswinger down the leg side
good length ball skirting outside off, Sanga's not tempted

huuuuge lbw shout and it looked quite  adjacent too! But it might have skipped over the stumps. A sharp indipper from Abbott, moved rather disconcertingly to rap Sanga on the back leg. And yep, HawkEye says it would have gone over
good length ball pushed across the left-hander, Sanga looks to defend and is beaten again
fuller delivery outside a little wider outside off, Sanga has an easy leave and Llong goes down to inspect the pitch for a bit
ohhh, another inswinger that wasn't too far away from the stumps. But Sanga has judged this well. Covered off stump and left it outside the eyeline

they've got the openers! And it's that phenomenal South Africa fielding again! Dale Steyn looks like his forehead is  made of veins and nothing but. Back of a length delivery, not quite wide enough for the slice behind point. But Dilshan goes for it and gets a thick outside edge. Faf is at second slip, he sees the ball dying as it comes to him so he dives forward and plucks a beauty!
145kph, full and a shade wide of off stump. Thirimanne is not lured into the drive
shortish and outside off, Thirimanne stands up and runs it down to third man. He's cranked his pace right up
full on off stump, Sanga - cool, solid Sanga - taps it into the covers
steps forward to a good length ball and opens the face to find point. Still not off the mark. Great pressure built up by South Africa's new-ball bowlers
shortish and it slips down the leg side, looks like the his striving for pace has messed with his radar. Also Steyn's feeling the back of his neck... ABs coming in to inspect it... What's up here?
full and just inside the tram line outside off, Sanga shoulders arms
back of a length on off stump, defended
inside edge with Abbott moving the ball into the left-hander. Wanted to find mid-off but instead settles for a single behind square leg
right up there a bit outside off stump, Thirmanne looks to mimic the man at the over end, but gets another inside edge to the intended cover drive
one practice run is enough! Sublime drive from Thirimanne. Split the gap between point and cover and just has to admire it

too much width there and Thirimanne has pounced on it and the so-long silent SCG wakes up! AB races after it, dives headlone after it to drag it back, but the ball's got too much legs, Hits him on the chin and bounces back into the boundary
good length ball on and around off stump, defended
back of a length and outside off, not bothered with
goes fuller and keeps it wide of Sanga's reach, lifts the bat high over his head. He's still on zero... 13 balls, 24 minutes, zero
148kph, shortish and lifting a shade outside off, Sanga drops the bat and his wrists and lets it pass him around his chest
146kph, back of a length and outside off, Sanga's buckling down to last the full overs it seems as he lets it go
there it is, waited and waited and waited until the ball on the pads came and he sends it down to long leg
immediate bouncer, but he's overstepped and the batsman ducked under it quite easily. Morkel checks on it and he seems displeased. But the umpire's right this time.

free hit banged in short and outside off, Thirimanne looks for the pull - bad choice considering the ball was outside off and it was soaring over his shoulder. Ball ends up with square leg. Might have tried the upper cut....
Fuller delivery on off stump, Sanga steps forward to push to mid-off
good length ball on off stump, defended stoutly to cover
fuller delivery on off stump, Sanga's straight bat answers
tests him around the off stump, Sanga's happy to hoist his bat over his head and let the good length ball pass. Excellent judgment
serene push to mid-off, exactly what the fuller delivery a shade outside off was asking for.
he's got the drives going, Sanga. All he needs to do is find the gap. De Villiers is at mid-off, so that might not be the best region to look for some. Second maiden for Steyn

this is hostile! Steyn's pace, Abbott's swing and now Morkel's bounce! It hit a good length and reared up and in at him sharply. Good on Thirimanne to use soft hands, gets a glove and then onto his body
more evidence of scary bounce from Morkel as he pitches it a shade short and it has the batsman leaping off his feet while trying to cut. Not quite wide enough for that shot and he's beaten
banged in closer to off stump, Thirimanne bends backward, drops his wrists and lets it go
good length ball tagged with a bit of width, Thirimanne seems to take that as a release and manages to beat Rossouw at point. Fingertip stuff! Boy, this new ball attack has picked itself up big time!
same tactic, but Thirimanne has cracked it over cover with consummate authority! Fuller and wider delivery dispatched just as his partner would have done
dropped and run to mid-off and AB hasn't got hold of the ball to throw. Thirimanne's fighting, Sanga's absorbing. The pressure is clear
good length ball on middle, defended to point
full and a bit too straight, Thirimanne has eased it between midwicket and square leg quite superbly. All timing there
stands up tall behind a shortish ball a shade outside off stump and taps it into the covers.

pitched up and Thirimanna has smoked it over mid-off! Talk about a counterpunch! Just enough width to free the arms and though it wasn't right off the middle, the intent is proving quite useful to Sri Lanka
fuller delivery on off stump, pushed to the left of mid-off
banged in short and Sanga swivels on the back foot to pull to long leg
shortish and outside off, Sanga is happy to see it through to the keeper
de Kock can't get to it this time. Morne has slid a back of a length delivery quite a way down leg and even a full length dive from the keeper can't stop it
fuller delivery on off stump, eased to point
good length ball on off stump, driven softly to mid-off and sets off right away, his eyes on AB who was swooping onto the ball. Thirimanne makes it, intent again!
back of a length and outside off, left
short delivery on off stump, Sanga is up on his toes and defends with soft hands

brute of a delivery again. Back of a length and bouncing a touch more than Sanga expects as he is lifted off his feet while trying to flick. Gets an inside edge that lops off the thigh pad towards gully

top-class stuff from JP! He had a stinging cover drive coming at him, dives to his right and stops a certain boundary and he was alert enough to throw the ball at the non-strikers' to keep Sanga honest
back of a length on off stump, defended
goes for the drive again and that time he was a bit lazy. Gets an outside edge to a good length ball outside off and picks up a single to third man
he's found the gap to the right of mid-off, Solid front foot stride and the perfect demonstration of the high-elbow. Steyn runs it down though
fuller delivery on off stump, punched to mid-off
Good length ball outside off, left alone and drops one bounce to the keeper, feels quite jarring after the pacy hostility of the first 10 overs.
full and wide outside off, Sanga reaches for it but cant
lifter outside off, Sanga lifts his hands high over his head and lets it go
Morkel's bounce goes against his team this time, four byes as Sanga pulls his bat away and the ball swings and soars away from the keeper. De Kock had no chance
back of a length and outside off, not bothered with
shortish on off stump, Sanga lets it come to him, absorbs all the pace and defends with soft hands
full and wide of off stump, drilled to mid-off
back of a length on off stump, defended
on the pads, Thirimanne has clipped it through midwicket. Look for a second, but MIller's too quick
stays beside the shortish ball and slices it to point
full on off stump, driven smartly into the covers
good length on off stump, Sanga looks for the gap between point and cover, but JP covers ground very well.
fuller and outside off stump, patted into the covers. Sanga inspects his bat and then calls for a replacement
tossed up on off stump, defended. He's bowling round the stumps
looped up outside off, threads the gap in the covers with a drive
pitched up on middle, Sanga clips to short midwicket
lots of flight, and Sanga almost hits it on the full to long-on
held it back just a touch on middle and leg, Thirimanne tucks it to short midwicket
tossed up outside off, Thirimanne pushes it through the covers to bring up the Sri Lanka fifty and drinks
flighted, middle and leg, overpitched, no time for spin. Defended back
tossed up outside off, again no time for the ball to turn as it is pitched up. Defended
short of a length, punched to mid-off
legbreak, middle and leg, defended to leg
a legbreak that doesn't turn as much as expected. Beats the outside edge. Tahir thinks he has edged it, but it doesn't matter. De Kock hasn't caught it. No edge anyway
Sanga attacks. He has to target at least one bowler. Moves inside the line and sweeps him over square leg for four
floated up wide, driven to deep cover for one
looks to drive a wide half-volley, gets a bottom edge
down the wicket, Duminy fires this in smartly. Defended back to him
down the wicket again, this time Duminy slows it down. Defended in front of off
overpitched, driven to long-off for one
short of a length, angling in, punched down to long-on
googly, overpitched, driven to extra cover
another googly, driven to long-off this time
tosses up a big wide down the leg side. Good take by de Kock on the half-volley
dances down the track to take this on the full, driven to long-off for one
quicker delivery, slightly short of a length, stays a touch low, kept out by Thiri
no slip. South Africa being South Africa? Tossed up outside off, Thiri plays for the legbreak, the ball doesn't turn as much, gets the edge, would have been a sitter for first slip
pushed towards cover as this too is pitched up
on a length, middle and leg, pushed to short straight midwicket
goes back to punch a length-ball offbreak to deep cover
too straight, they have been looking to cramp Sanga, and he strays down a touch. Clipped away fine
short of a length, into the pads, punched away to deep midwicket
short of a length, on off, punched down the ground, can't beat short straight midwicket
flighted around off, he looks to drive, the ball doesn't turn, runs off the inside half towards long-on

Tahir goes on a run towards deep midwicket. Huge wicket. Thirimanne is gone. He has looked superb so far. A legbreak from round the wicket, pitches on a length, just outside off, Thirimanne looks for a single to long-on, the ball stops a little. He is early into the shot, the ball has bounced too. Off the high part of the bat it lobs back to the left of Tahir who dashes across Sanga and takes it two-handed
perfect legbreak. On off, defended from the crease
googly, too straight, helped around the corner for a couple
full and straight, no turn, defended to midwicket
slower through the air, legbreak, turns away from outside off, Mahela pushes inside the line
overpitched, clipped away off the toe, past midwicket
flatter and quicker and sliding down leg as well. Mahela looks to tickle it, but can't connect
good length ball on middle, turned to short midwicket
slides another tossed up delivery down leg side. Why is he bowling so nervously?
"ohhh, yes" says the keeper loudly after a tossed up delivery outside off is turned to midwicket
flighted outside off, turned behind square leg as he lunges with the front foot
stands on off stump and turns a good length ball through midwicket
flat and quick on middle, nudged to midwicket
flighted on middle, Sanga gets inside the line and drives to long-off
goes back to a good length ball and taps it to the bowler
flighted outside off, Sanga gets forward to find long-off
gets forward, waits for the delivery to land by his front foot and defends
ample turn! Ripping delivery pitching a shade outside off and leaping away past the outside edge
flighted outside off, Mahela presses forward and works it to mid-on

huuuuge appeal, Tahir goes for about five of those and AB's been pressured into going for possibly a bad review. This is a tossed up googly to which Mahela is forward to block. Seemed to play it outside the line. Struck on the knee-roll. Could have been a great wicket, but it was only close
flat and quick on middle and leg, Sanga backs away and cuts
goes back after he gets a little more room and cuts to deep point

Rossouw almost causes chaos! Both batsmen were nearly at the same end but the fielder doens't get the ball cleanly. Mahela had played a delicate late cut, but Rossouw's agility had him nervous. Sanga not so as he just charged out. In the end, they take the single
flighted on middle and leg, nudged off his pads
tossed up on leg stump, driven to long-on
backs away to a flatter delivery outside off and cuts past point

quick, on middle, skids on and Mahela has presented a simple catch to short midiwcket. Du Plessis is elated with the dolly but of course, no one can compare with Tahir's celebrations. Goes off for another lap of the city. The pressure was piling on and on and out came this shortish delivery. Mahela thought it was the release, but then realised he did not have any room. Was caught in two minds and in the end gave catching practice
tossed up on off, it was the googly too, defended off the inside edge
tossed up a shade outside off, Angelo is forward with a block
lures him on the drive, with short cover in place, that's a good ploy. Doesn't reach the man
flighted on off stump, punched to mid-off
another googly, this one is picked and Sanga drives it behind point
tossed up on off stump, Mathews covers for it and blocks
down the track, gets to the pitch of a length ball and pushes to long-on
leans forward to try and drive to long-off, but JP gets across and dives to rein it in
flighted on off stump, tapped back to the bowler as Allan Donald continues yelling instructions from beyond the boundary
manages to beat the bowler on his right and picks up a single on the off drive
length ball on off stump, whipped through midwicket. Mathews waits for the ball to beat the fielder's dive and then trots across
legspinner making Mathews reach outside off to block
excellent length and line from Tahir as he brings Mathews forward to block
ends up a low full toss which Mathews puts away to deep square leg. That drift he's been getting works against him there
tossed up on off stump, turning back into him, Sanga blocks with bat in front of pad
appears to be the googly on leg stump, tucked behind square leg
gets down the track and drives to long-off. Good batting against tight bowling
full and wide outside off, Sanga slaps it off the front foot to deep point
back of a length and Mathews gets across to it outside off and blocks
straying a bit too straight, Mathews clips off his hips and finds square leg
shortish on middle and leg, Mathews is pushed off his feet as he tickles it fine
gets inside the line of a short delivery on middle and pulls to long leg
banged in to Sanga as well, who weaves away from it
flighted on middle, nudged to short midwicket
hammered over long-on! Mathews has had it with all the pressure. Saw the ball flighted and Mathews strengthens the bottom hand hold of the bat and almost whips a loft over wide long-on
flatter and quicker outside off, Sanga gets back and punches down the ground
flighted outside off, driven calmly to long-on
a hint more bounce than expected as Mathews set up for the cut to a short ball, but has to adjust. Dabs it to point instead
full and wide, eased throughthe covers to bring up the hundred and stirs the Sri Lanka fans to life

144 kph, targets the body and Mathews was in no position to handle it. He was tucking his head under his shoulder, bringing his bat up to protect himself and is struck on his gloves. Time for a break as Mathews calls on the physio. Left hand, possibly the index finger, is the one in strife. Magic spray time. Some tape as well. All good now

He is in play! Rossouw was the man diving away to his left to try and hold on! Another short ball angled into the body and Mathews jumps inside the line and fends it away towards square leg. Rossouw was so close
gets across on off stump to tuck a shortish delivery towards short square leg
digs it into the middle of the deck, but this is a shade outside off. With bodily harm out of the way, Mathews blocks
back of a length and outside off, punched into the covers
shortish on off stump, tapped into the covers for a quick single
fuller delivery outside off, Mathews taps to mid-off
goes short, but he doesn't have Morkel's bounce. Pulls comfortably to deep midwicket
fuller delivery outside off, Sanga unveils an eye-catching drive through point
nails a yorker on middle, Mathews clips it behind square leg
flighted outside off, pushed to mid-off
flatter delivery outside off, punched through the covers
flighted outside off, worked past mid-on
leans forward and drives into the covers. Good, teasing flight from JP
a hint of drift in and turn away from the bat, Sanga pushes to mid-off
JP dives to his right, Faf dives across in the other direction from short cover and they prevent the Sanga tap from going past them
Steyn's on his knees after he strikes Mathews above his knees! But height was an issue. The impact was in line with middle but umpire Llong has judged this well. Says too high and HawkEye agrees
back of a length and outside off, punched to mid-off
shortish and outside off, Mathews shuffles across and blocks to cover
full on middle, Mathews is far more comfortable with this line as he clips through square leg
fullish on off stump and as elegant as he drives into the off side, he can't get the gap
opens the face against a fuller ball and sends the ball to the sweeper
tossed up and cramping him up on middle, pushed back at the bowler
pushed to long-on, AB runs in from midwicket and throws himself at the ball. He had absolutely no chance to stop it, but he gave it his all
the outside edge makes a timely appearance - there was no slip there - and Mathews picks up a couple. Excellent control from Duminy
nudged down to long-on
stays in line with a good length ball on leg and clips it to midwicket

poor shot! Runs at the bowler, tries to whip a flighted delivery from way outside off through midwicket. He should have lifted it over the infield, or kept it all along the ground. Not some in-between flick. Throws his head back as Faf takes another dolly. JP has been so tight, he's not allowed the slightest release of pressure and gets just rewards. That's also drinks
flatter and quicker outside off, sliced behind point. There were chances for a second, but Sanga's slipped
pitched right up outside off and Thisara's dug it out
prods nervously forward and the drive nearly carries to the short cover fielder

taken at slip! Cramps him for room, his slider gets on quickly to Thisara who was trying to back away and punch into the covers. Only ends up with an outside edge that sits snugly in slip's hands. Had a little pitstop at the keeper's gloves in between
flighted on leg stump, clipped to deep midwicket
looped up outside off, Sanga gets forward, takes it on the full and drives to cover

Kula walks! This was flighted outside off, doesn't quite turn, the batsman plays for it. His face was closed, he was looking midwicket. Instead the deflection is pouched extremely well by de Kock. Stayed low when he needed to

two in two, make that three in three! It's a hat-trick! JP is mobbed! This was a good length ball but doesn't turn as much. Kaushal was camped deep in his crease and was playing all around it. Plumb in front
could have been four in four - tossed up at the base of off stump and it's been defended
goes back to a good length ball and blocks to cover
looped up outside off, Chameera looks to drive and is beaten. For once, so is de Kock
goes back to block a very similar delivery that got rid of Kaushal. Flat and pushing in on off stump. Chameera though plays with a straight bat
slanted across the left-hander, slashes and misses
shortish and outside off, cut away to deep third man
walks across outside off and he has enough room to crack a cut. Beats deep third man. Brilliant timing, but is it too late?
nips down the track and lifts a good length ball over the covers
a shade short and Sanga wanders outside off to pull through midwicket. Two fours in the space of three balls, should Sanga have pulled these out earlier?
full and wide outside off, Sanga leans forward and lashes it over the covers. Resounding crack off the bat
full and wide, Sanga clears his front leg for a slap down the ground and misses

short and wide, Sanga goes for a cut..... and holes out at deep third man! He was trying to get it finer, leans away from the ball to get leverage. Strikes it well, but fails to find the gap. That's been a perfect summary of this strange innings from a great player. Bogged down, scratchy, tragic
runs away from the back of a length delivery and pokes. No hope of connecting
goes fuller and flirts with off stump. Malings dopes his bit for the love story as he backs away again. Showed all his stumps and is beaten
full on middle, Malinga manages to get his bat down in time

clears his front leg and swats it down the ground. Went off the splice and lands safely. Meanwhile, the bowler has overstepped. The two tail-enders try and sneak a third run. Good, flat throw at the bowler's end where the fielder grabbed it and threw it to the keeper. But Chameera's safe
shortish on off stump, Chameera is rooted the the crease and tries a pull. It's too quick for him and the ball lobs over mid-on
a shortish delivery outside off, Malinga punches it into the covers
tonked straight into cover's hands! Tahir has his fourth! It's shortish, it has width, it's been cut with precision to David Miller.

inn2.comm: ovepitched and the mighty Hash has smoked it through the covers! Leans forward and takes full toll of the loose delivery
gets across on middle and off to punch a back of a length delivery into the covers
bat face closes as it makes impact with one that is just short of a good length. Seemed like Amla was into his back foot cover drive too early
banged in short and a shade outside off, Hash slips under it
back of a lenght and outside off, left for the keeper
fuller delivery with a hint of movement away, Amla decides on an on-the-up drive and misses
flatter delivery from around the wicket, punched down to long-on
flatter delivery on off stump, pushed to mid-on
goes back and whips a good length ball to deep midwicket
a shade outside off on a full length as well, de Kock pushes into the covers. Doesn't quite move the feet yet
pushed back at the bowler
tossed up on the pads and de Kock nudges it to short midwicket. Good work there
goes short and Amla loads up for the pull. The ball reached him quicker than he expected to chip some of his timing away. Finds a couple to deep midwicket
back of a length and nipping away off the deck, Amla doesn't move his feet and pokes outside off. Beaten
short and wide, Amla flays it to deep third man
moves around the wicket and nails a toe-crusher. Speared in from quite wide and it comes in quite sharply with the angle. De Kock manages to flick it to square leg and smiles having survived a beauty
good length ball on off stump, blocked
gets across on off stump and turns a back of a length ball on off stump into the perfect delivery to flick off the hips
gets a good length ball to come in at Amla, who is happy to turn it down to long leg
sliced through point and his timing is quite striking. Hint of width and he's chopped it through the gap. Nods to his partner, he knows that was the shot that could get him back in form
creamed through point again! he looks like he's the one smoking hundreds four matches in a row! A little short, a little wide and dispatched
back of a length on off stump, punched to mid-off

worked from outside off to the midwicket boundary, a la his opening partner and his predecessor (Greame Smith). Goes back and flicks a good length ball on top of the bounce and he times the ball so sweetly
stays beside the ball, camps on the back foot and taps a shortish delivery into the covers
shortish and outside off, Amla goes back and across and works it through midwicket
searing, inswinging yorker at the base of middle stump. Deserved a wicket but de Kock is stubborn. Terrific ball, Immense skill from the batsman too

slower ball, ends up a full toss outside off, slid to the point boundary. That really shouldn't have reached the rope. It looked like de Kock was reaching, he barely struck the ball, it was just placement...
looks for another yorker, but just misses the mark. De Kock whips it through midwicket's legs. Terrible work from Kusal Perera. Oh, and Malinga had overstepped as well. Very tight call
comes over the wicket for a free hit nails a yorker a shade outside off, sliced into the covers
another yorker seeking middle stump, de Kock moves his feet out of the way to remove lbw out of play and pushes down the ground
change of pace, good length ball angled across the left-hander and de Kock is into his push a touch too early. Beaten
tossed up down the leg side, Amla must have got a little bit of pad to it
tossed up on middle and leg, defended
goes back to a flatter delivery on off stump and punches to mid-off
flighted on middle, Amla takes it on the full and flicks it behind square leg. Deep midwicket has to run around and cut it short of the boundary
good length ball on middle and leg, tucked behind square leg. His action is certainly like Murali's, but he's not turning the ball
there we go, a hint of movement away from the batsman and de Kock is beaten. Had tried to knock it to third man, didn't look convincing
fuller delivery on off stump, Amla simply caresses it down the ground past mid-off for a couple
the slingy arm fails there as the shortish delivery wanders away wide of off stump
fullish on off stump, blocked
back of a length and outside off, Amla is happy to see it off to the keeper

Kula runs around, dives and takes a beautiful catch at deep third man! The umpire's are checking the front foot, has he overstepped?! This is seriously tight! Seriously tight. And the benefit of the doubt goes to the bowler. Amla's gone. It was short and wide, he went for a cut and didn't bother with keeping it down. The fielder ran around, had his eyes on the ball all the way and claimed it excellently. And that's the supper break
full length, wide of the stumps and that's in de Kock's spank-me zone, leans out to larrup a drive through cover point
well-diredted bouncer to follow up, the batsman jerks underneath it
sliding through from around the wicket, plays back defensively outside off
flatter and a touch quicker on the stumps, du Plessis stays in the crease and nudges to leg, gets off the mark
tossed up, not much turn and de Kock defends around off stump
shuffles across and plays a length ball back towards the man coming in at mid-off
flighted, dipping towards middle and off and straightening a touch, de Kock leans out and defends watchfully
gives this some air again, lots of wrist going into Kaushal's deliveries, though minimal grip so far, de Kock again defends on the front foot
shortish and in the channel outside off, du Plessis dabs this down behind gully and they hustle back for a second
slung down in the corridor, leaving the batsman and he watches it through
shortish length, stays back and opens the face, runs the ball along the ground to third slip
dug in short again, sits up for du Plessis to paddle around the corner for one through square
continues with the bouncer attack, leaping off that awkward trajectory at around 138kph, de Kock swipes at it but fails to connect

Malinga has overstepped and he's also been swatted over midwicket by de Kock, takes on the short ball again and gets hold of this one, maybe off the toe but cleared the infield and nearly went all the way to the boundary
another extra, Malinga is giving SA room to breathe - slings this wide in the channel
low arm, skidding through outside off, close to the tramlines again but Nigel Llong gives him this one
flighted on the stumps, closes the face and whips through square leg
tossed up outside off, du Plessis reaches out and strokes a couple into the gap between backward point and cover
a chance?! Maybe not... The ball didn't go to hand but short leg was interested, signs of some spin for Kaushal but think it only flicked the thigh pad
gets out and punches one more in front of square
angled in and straightening on the stumps, defends to the on side
drops just a fraction short and de Kock rocks back to clock it through backward point, really socked it and the ball races away
starts slightly short and pushed into a gap in the covers
slightly overpitched in the channel outside off and de Kock skelps another boundary, using Dushmantha's pace to crump a cover drive for four
short now and pulled away - this was touching 145kph/90mph but de Kock is seeing it big and whipped his hands through the shot. Called for a front-foot no-ball, too, though it looked tight
good comeback, slips in a fast yorker outside off, de Kock was back on his heels and couldn't get the bat down
a bumper this time, fast and climbing but down the leg side
banged in halfway down and de Kock slaps another dismissive pull through square, there's a man out there as cover now
full and straight, tailing towards leg stump and clipped away fore a couple more through backward square
short again, boinging up and high over du Plessis' cross-batted slash... Sangakkara appeals but there's some kidology involved there, I think, definitely a wide on height
fuller and in the channel, thickish outside edge squirts away down to third man
stays back and works the ball away towards midwicket
some gasps among the Sri Lanka fielders as de Kock pushes forward and the ball loops back in front of square leg... might have been some glove invovled but it fell safely
flighted, nice and slow, de Kock gets low and paddles one through short fine leg
oof, done him, for no reward! Pushed through a little flatter outside off, du Plessis goes for a big drive and is beaten. Doosra?
tossed up and spinning back in as du Plessis gets forward to defend
floated up and du Plessis carefully pats back down the track once again
pitched up and dispatched back down the ground, lovely timing from de Kock, stroking an on-drive to the boundary
Dushmantha has changed his angle, bowling around the wicket, slings this waaaaaaaaaaaay down the leg side and Sanga can't get to it

done him for pace but it goes for four more! De Kock was a little cramped trying to hook a short ball, it rose higher than he expected, zinged the top of his helmet and disappeared over the cordon for leg byes
short again, he's going at it hammer and tongs but de Kock has been smelted from strong stuff and he batters a pull to deep square leg
fullish this time and in the channel, du Plessis elects to leave it alone
angled in and worked away to the leg side
bouncer, fired down the leg side again - this time Sanga keeps the damage to one

another short ball, little less gas behind this one and pulled comfortably along the ground to deep backward square - that's de Kock's fifty, just a momentary acknowledgement but what a handy knock this has been, looking like a match-winner for South Africa in a knockout match. There, I said it
tossed up, gets down low and sweeps a couple behind square
around the wicket, flighted and played back down the track
tossed up, comes forward and punches one down the ground
gets forward and defends a flighted delivery
full outside the line of off and du Plessis taps one down the ground, brings up three figures for SA
there's a whirl of arms, the ball drifts in towards the pads, de Kock pushes to mid-on
starts a touch short and the batsman goes back and across to defend
fuller, around off stump, pushed into the covers as du Plessis shuffles forwards
goes short, not much quicker than 130kph/80mph, de Kock whistles a pull away for four more through midwicket
pushed wider, on a length, sits back and cracks a cut shot in front of square, only picks out the man set back at cover
goes big, huuuuuuge roundhouse pull out towards deep midwicket, where Kusal Perera very nearly pulls off a sensational diving catch... but only succeeds in punching it to the rope for four more
slower ball, comes out wrong, down the leg side
slightly back of a length outside off and de Kock swings and misses
slightly short to begin with, du Plessis stays in the crease and crunches a couple through the covers
on the stumps, flicked off the pads to midwicket
flat delivery outside off, slapped off the back foot through the covers for two
tossed up, de Kock skips out and chips a drive over the bowler's head, long-on comes across to prevent four
tight line, skidding on to the pads as de Kock looked to work it away
angled in with the arm, turned away through square leg
signs of turn for Kaushal, takes the outside edge as de Kock pushed forwards, wasn't to the pitch but the nick died and ran away to third man
around the wicket, floated up and straightening a touch on middle and off, defended
flighted, around off stump, du Plessis lunges forward and there's bat and pad involved, not sure which was first muted appeal from SL but Llong isn't interested
too straight this time, just a tickle of bat and it runs fine for a couple
another appeal, this time for a bat-pad catch at short leg, du Plessis played down the wrong line and the ball ballooned up... don't think there was any glove on it
du Plessis is definitely struggling a little with Kaushal here, tries to hit his away out and is beaten again, the ball skidding through outside off, not far wide of the timber
starrs short and slightly wide, floaty slower-ball bouncer, cut imperiously away through backward point
pitched up in the channel, opens the face and runs to third man
short again and chopped through point for a couple more
banged, de Kock wafts at it, judged to be too high again - another extra donated to the SA anti-choke fund
slung in short of a length again, again de Kock fails to get anything on it
goes full, around the line of off, dipping towards the blockhole but de Kock drops his bat on it

slower ball outside off, de Kock thrashes it away through the covers - that's it, those are the winning runs, South Africa win by nine wickets, they win a knockout game at a World Cup for the first time, they're into the semi-finals!
